Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Glorby goodness
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Looking to really STUFF YER GILLS?! GET A SHARING DESSERT PLATTER unnnf

29vwPjVLbiPSockdxGplsw.text: I gotta say I was a little disappointed with my meal. I suppose I came into it with high expectations since the restaurant specializes in vegetarian food...so I thought hey of course it is going to be good. But eh... judging off what I ordered, I wouldn't make a point to come back.   My boyfriend and I decided to order two main dishes and split them. We ordered the vegetable stir fry udon noodles with smoked tofu and the  Chilli pancake with grilled sweet potato, courgette and chocolate sauce. In my opinion the stir fry's flavoring was off. I can pinpoint what it was, but I didn't care for it. The chili pancake was pretty good but the chocolate sauce killed it for me. I'm not sure if they were going for a mole' taste, but the chocolate sauce tasted like melted hersheys. It didn't make sense in the dish and I would have liked it a lot more if it was left out.   However, my friend ordered the risotto of roasted red pepper with kale and kohlrabi - I tried a bite and it was delicious.   Also, our waitress was an absolute joy. She was attentive, sweet and charming. I can also say the double gin and tonic was potent - which is always a plus.   All in all, I say this place is ok. Id stay away from the stir fry and chili pancake.

EubnUDXSTsMLtDUmL2nj8A.text: After a full afternoon at the Edinburgh Castle we needed a place to relax and have a great meal. David Bann met all the marks. Entering we were welcomed and led to a table in the middle of a bright, modern dining room. The service was good and attentive without being intrusive.  From the beer selection to the food it was wonderful. Try the heather beer taken from a 4000 year old receipe. It was difficult to make choices from the starters and entrees but we had the polenta with roasted veggies and pesto except for the bland cheese all the parts of the dish came together. Our entree was likewise impressive with  the spicy kafta (croquette) and the sweet plums a perfect compliment to each other.  Finally the three ice cream dessert was rich and refreshing. After our experience we were ready to see more of Edinburgh.

xUcuTnnB_X7KkHUXA30GqQ.text: Oh goodness--- one of the best vegetarian meal I've had.  We had a party of 4, and everyone loved their meals. Go early if you don't have reservations.  Highly recommend.

n2Ruyu2eLXVxIhyfr3eWDg.text: Awesome place! Great food and friendly happy staff! Highly recomend this for any veg lookin for a great meal experience in Edinburgh! Price was very reasonable. I had 2 apps, a main, 2 tall tasty brews and an espresso and it was right at 30.

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

utPLi9Uu46l3mnfvN0wSbQ.text: This place has got me looking at vegetables in a whole new light!! The food is brilliant, different and excellent value for money. The restaurant is quite big but yet feels cosy and the staff very chatty, friendly and helpful. Starter homemade basil ravioli was presented gorgeously and tasted lovely, mains were inventive and inspiring - chilli bean pancake with dark chocolate sauce was a taste sensation! The mushroom strudel very good and aubergine and chick pea koftas bursting with flavour and taste. Every dish was served hot and on warm plates:) Happy days! We shared a vegan desert of raspberry jelly with coconut sorbet which was the perfect end to a perfect meal. Well done David Bann. 117 total bill for 3 starters, 3 mains, 1 desert, 1 bottle house champagne and water. Excellent value for money. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beautiful desert!
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mushroom masterpiece

z9L40jRwmxhW6d2IWDPd6g.text: Amazing restaurant. I was searching for a vegan/vegetarian restaurant in Edinburgh and I found this place. The food is very well done and they have both vegan and vegetarian options. Not the same basic food you find everywhere but very good and interesting dishes. I would definitely recommend to go there if you search something different. Also the portions are quiet big and I was very full at the end of the meal.

BV4nsEIQtmIEYzDUiWp8QQ.text: This was the meal I was most looking forward to in my vacation to Scotland. Although it was not the best vegetarian meal in the UK it was above average. If youre looking for a unique meal, i would recommend DB.  Here's what we ordered: - sweet potato & orange soup of the day: quite a remarkable balance of sweet potato and wee hint of orange. It actually sounded unpleasant bc of the citrus but my fiance ordered it and when i tried it I found it to be quite good.  - tofu appetizer: a total miss due to lack of texture. The exterior had no crispness, it was rather rubbery on the outside and mushy inside. The tofu had a hint of smoke but no other taste stood out. The mango curry sauce  to smear on the tofu helped the dish be palatable. The issue was the size of the tofu. There are 2 large triangles about 3 inches thick. That is too large to get proper texture.  Also the mango chutney needed to be more of a sauce for spreadability.    - chickpea curry: right amount of heat.  - quinoa entree wrapped in grilled zuchinni: creative but too dry.  This needed a sauce. And protein. The lack of protein in the dishes was disappointing.  The environment does nothing to enhance the dining experience. I can appreciate mminimalism if it is done well and this attempt missed the mark. 2 dark colored walls and meager lighting fixture were blah but the candle lighting on the tables are enough to keep the place at a good date spot.

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Quinoa, wrapped in grilled zuchinni with a beet puree. Fair attempt but not blown away. Too dry.
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bland interior.
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tofu appetizer. Bland. Not good texture.

_PcFzomELRt8T-HXetGuDQ.text: "David Bann Vegetarian Restaurant" reads the outside window. For some reason I feel like vegetarian restaurants get a bad rap or are second class citizens to full spectrum places but David Bann would be a hard place to compete with, even if you did serve meat.  To start with, it's a very elegant place. The decor is tasteful, refined, with tablecloths. The waiters are well dressed and the lights are dimmed. Actually, since I came for a dinner with friends, I was slightly concerned it was too nice for a fairly casual dinner. However, the waiters were very kind, and the prices were reasonable for a nicer place.  The food, though, is what deserves the real praise, since it was fantastic! I had the strudel which was mushroom and goat cheese baked in filo with fried polenta on the side. It was one of the heavier options available but still didn't make me feel too heavy afterwards.   One of my friends enjoyed the risotto which was very tasty as well, can definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My goat cheese and mushroom strudel.

xC9mScNBCvj1uqb2def9Yg.text: An all around good choice for service, atmosphere, food, and a nice bottle of Tempranillo.  A well located vegetarian restaurant a short walk off the Royal Mile.  Appetizers were a blue cheese and cherry tomato tartlet with caramelized onion.  And a spicier choice, a Aubergine, chickpea and cashew kofta with banana chutney.  Both were very, very good and the highlight of the meal (not that the mains were bad).  Mains were a Risotto, baked parsnip pudding, a mushroom sTruedel and aduki bean stew.  All were good but did not rise to the level of the appetizers.

KimbERPyLJGi_nw_4LU_Nw.text: This is a classy restaurant in the old part of Edinburgh not too far from the castle. The restaurant has a vegetarian menu that includes many interesting and unique vegan dishes. Our meals were exquisite. I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes or is willing to try a vegan/vegetarian meal. I would go definitely go back if I ever return to Edinburgh.

5I0Tc7P4nc5tyX93L3SQRQ.text: The dish we ordered was advertised to have udon noodles but they were closer to Fettucine and didn't remotely resemble the thickness of an udon noodle. The dish was super saucy and had too many toppings on it. Despite the main course being instantly inadequate the dessert was lush and for for a king/queen. Overall it was unappetizing and I would never come back here unless it was for dessert.

RFZk_lcgE9COQ6wCZDcRhQ.text: I went to David Bann after a sweaty Sunday morning walk up to Alfred's Seat. They have an inexpensive Saturday/Sunday brunch dish but I decided to go for a couple of menu items ... and I'm glad I did. The homemade hummus was out of this world, especially topped with the tomato curry on those oatmeal crackers that it came with. (I went gluten-free this day so didn't taste the homemade bread.) For an entree I ordered baked parsnip pudding with potato and swede dauphinoise. Turns out this is actually two things: the parsnip pudding looks like a biscuit but definitely tastes like a pudding - not a desert pudding but a savory, smooth dinner pudding. The potato and swede dauphinoise is layered like a lasagne would be. (Swede is a root vegetable of which I hadn't heard.) it too was delicious and smooth. The carrot that came with was perfectly roasted, and all this food sat atop a perfectly crafted roasted carrot and green pea sauce. The service was excellent although at 11:30 AM I was the only one there. By the time i left two hours later the place had filled up. And no wonder!

kbl4vlZm3sETO1SyR0fKkw.text: This restaurant feels like you are having a great meal and you forget you are In a vegetarian restaurant.  We had the Thai fritters that were absolutely amazing.  I also had the mushroom goat cheese and heather ale stelrudel which was equally good.  The lentil Shepard's pie was a Good also.    The only thing that was a bummer was when we ready to have dessert they told us that they needed the table in a half hour and we should essentially rush.  The problem was that they took their time serving each dish we figured they were ok with it.  We would have ordered earlier but we didn't know.  So we can't comment on dessert. We even commented that we felt we were on European time.  So be to told we had to rush was a downer and a mood kill.

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Thai fritters-- wow!
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Dining area

bLIuuMZSZxLpbfAral8vyQ.text: It's been a long time since I've been to Bann's, but as I had a couple of hours to spare and happened to be at this end of town, I decided to treat myself. It was early, so the place was pretty empty so I was soon ensconced in a seat by the window.  Having so many yummy veggie & vegan things on the menu, it's hard to choose what to eat - it's such a luxury knowing that you can eat practically anything on the menu for once! I eventually settled for the Thai fritter of broccoli and marinated tofu starter, followed by stir-fried veg with Udon noodles and smoked tofu for the main, washed down with a large glass of Chilean Carmenere - a red wine that until recently was mistaken for a Merlot, according to the wine list. I'm not sure that it was the correct choice for my meal as I found it rather too rich for my taste, but it was an excellent wine nonetheless.  Everything too delicious for words, especially the main course which came topped with the biggest slab of tofu I've ever seen on a dish. However, I think I will still reserve my accolade of "best tofu in the known Universe" for the Hanoi Bike Shop in Glasgow.   So hat's off to Banns - still as good as I remembered. I'll try not to leave it as long before my return.

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mixed veg on Udon noodles with tofu.
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Thai fritters.
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

9cQ4WKWv95cvIFDiU4UN9A.text: I came here for dinner while in Edinburgh, and overall was content with the experience although it wasn't the most mind blowing vegetarian experience I've had.   We called ahead to snag a table here on a Saturday night around 8:30. The restaurant was mostly full, and when we came in we were happy with how good it smelled and also how cozy and warm it was (we chose a cold weekend to visit the city apparently). I ordered the smoked tofu and udon noodles with veggies and my boyfriend had the aubergine kofta. Our meals were good, and I especially enjoyed the smoked tofu. I felt like overall the menu was quite safe and not so exciting. I wouldn't come back.

Dz8q8O3dqcM4DE2dh8DtDw.text: Really good food. Very impressed by how vegan/vegetarian dining is elevated to classy/fancy dining at this restaurant. The koftas weren't as outstanding as I had been led to believe based on the previous recommendations. The chili was also okay but not amazing. I think the chili could have benefited with less potatoes and the presence of a faux meat like seitan or soy crumbles. The tofu appetizer was not very impressive and was literally a block of tofu. The mushroom strudel however was amazing. Would come back to try the rest of the menu.

owm0w8v7t2tCz7-4qRCj4A.text: The fennel salad [7.95] which had raspberries in it was good., as was the soup of the day [4.25] which was butternut squash with ginger. For the main courses we had the spicy chili [13.50] and the noodles with tofu [12.50]. They were healthy but not especially tasty. The chili came with the worst tasting guacamole I've ever had and some very delicious chocolate sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salad

6NROHDEtwcA6qTAhlZaa9Q.text: I've been wanting to try David Bann for a few years and eventually got a chance to make a reservation whilst holidaying in Edinburgh during November 2016. I visited with a party of four and we pre-booked our table, which I would recommend as this is a very busy restaurant.   It's decorated in dark, rich wood and shades of aubergine, however bright lighting and a large open plan dining room ensure the overall atmosphere is relaxed and informal. On arrival we were seated and offered complimentary bread rolls. There's so much selection on the menus, David Bann really is Vegetarian Heaven so it took us ages to decide what to order.  Our starters consisted of one hummus with chutney and bread, one goats cheese, caramelised onion and sun blush tomato tartlet and two Thai fritters of smoked tofu, broccoli, ginger, chilli, lemongrass, sesame and coriander served with fresh banana chutney and plum sauce. Everything was sublime, unique, delicious and flavourful.  For my main I choose a parsnip, apple and blue cheese pudding served with roast vegetables and puy lentil stew. It was fantastic. My three dinning companions, even the carnivores, loved their mains as well. They all opted for the aubergine, chick pea and cashew koftas served with roasted sweet potato in a spicy coconut sauce plus green beans and sweet papaya side salad.  Service from our waiter was impeccable and although we initially planned to have three courses we were so full after two we just couldn't manage dessert. Nonetheless we've resolved to return and try the dessert menu when next in Edinburgh. David Bann is now one of my favourite restaurants and I would literally travel to Edinburgh just to dine here. I would highly recommended this restaurant, even those who aren't Vegetarian will enjoy the gorgeous food.

YfxeaKNUYyOKb1jnFmQvqQ.text: Fantastic food, great service and a cozy space. Perfect for our 10 year anniversary. Can't wait to go back. Thanks for making it special!

d6HrNfqaNA7ylWPG2qKaDg.text: Dinner here last night was such a pleasure! Comfortable setting, friendly service, and wonderful food. Between us, we sampled half a dozen entrees, four starters, two desserts - all tasty treats, thanks to servers who gave us completely trustworthy advice.       We'll be back!

6AjsqkhCoCn0JBm_Ecf-kA.text: So good that the Duchess and I dined here twice during a three-day stay.  Everything we tried was outstanding, and the best of the best were the "Risotto of braiesed leek and roasted red pepper," the "Puy lentil shepherd's pie with roasted vegetables," and the "Dark chocolate souffle." This last was the finest we have ever had, so richely flavored and creamy inside.  Lovely ambience too, and friendly service.

dMBl24Uq1hgRswHdyGAOnQ.text: Elegant, innovative and flavorful, but not the best I've had in other cities - but those were considerably more expensive. Good service, nice setting and busy so reservations recommended but we did not have one and got in at 7pm.

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Couldn&#39;t wait - beetroot and cheese soufflé with broccoli and polenta.
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Asparagus risotto
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tartet of asparagus, blue cheese and tomato appetizer

_U8ikZdpIvgEpIYOU9ZHUQ.text: Fantastic vegetarian cuisine with great service. The presentation was beautiful and the flavors complex and layered. Wish I could put this place in my pocket and bring it with me throughout the rest of Scotland!

SZAXuVr2khhhy0tw7a8SUQ.text: Ok so a fabled 5 star review from myself - only because this place delivered exactly what I was after and that was due to the following reasons:  * Fantastic vegetarian food and very reasonable prices. The Thai fritter to start and kofta for mains was tres kick ass!!   * Great staff - nothing was too much trouble - I even got a last minute reservation when this place fills up often.   * Tasty pear juice to drink seemed nice and fresh.   * Seeing as I was dining alone it didn't drag and I had 2 courses and still got to check out the ambience within an hour.   * The price again - around 20 for starter, a main and a juice!

photos.caption: Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vege kofta
Photo of David Bann - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tasty Thai fritters

G6NvHDHLlYTQSQTMyxz0xA.text: Delicious, classy, excellent service, and reasonably priced. And it was so nice to be able to order freely without worrying if something had meat in it! Everything we had was fantastic.

v6xloD2s-nrannrIvAp2pw.text: I am writing this review after having been to Davin Bann twice. Both times around I was impressed with the range of food on offer i.e. it was not all "same-y" and how much of the menu was also Vegan. I was a little disappointed with my main on my first trip but my boyfriends meal was nice however the starters and deserts were fab. The second time I was not disappointed and the waiter on this time was very helpful (advising us that the bread and olives was a rather large starter and really best for sharing as I was going to have it alone). The menu changes regularly which means that there is always something new to try. The good thing is the vegan chocolate ice cream never leaves.

1WVs5kYIvduvFw5-AuqzSA.text: I'd say this is a pretty average establishment all in all. It is pretty unusual to have a veggie restaurant with this sort of vibe, modern and dressed to impress, which is a welcome change to knitted tables (although I'm fond of such things). And although the food is nice, the flavours in themselves are very much like other good veggie restaurants. And unlike other veggie restaurants the price tag is pretty high.   I wouldn't go back, as I think you can get the same quality at other places in a more honest fashion. By that I suppose I mean cheaper.

RngLAfUmVtoLPqUZtPcJmw.text: Walking in without a reservation, was slightly apprehensive if its going to be too busy and we would be turned away! but it wasn't too busy, and we were welcomed in, decor is very chic and modern and simplistic at the same time, service was very good with attentive staff. Food was brilliant and as the review rightly said in-spite of being a meat lover, I was spoilt for choice, menu choice is good, for starters we had the Tartlet of blue cheese and slow dried tomato, which was delicious, followed by mains of Chilli crepe with griddled potato and chocolate sauce & Aduki and pistachio koftas. The food was well presented and delicious, though the quantity seemed just a little bit too much. For the desert had the vegan chocolate ice cream which was again very yummy.

_yJJwGK0r8Rsacb4XoaXnw.text: our starters were absolutely amazing, yet our entrees fell a little short.  maybe we ordered things that strayed from our taste aesthetics, but we were slightly disappointed, though it was definitely edible.  maybe our starter dishes simple set the bar very high.  this all vegetarian with vegan options menu had just enough selection to warrant another visit, yet not so much one would feel confused where to start.  the staff was great.  no one person helped us, but our very attentive staff also did not inundate us with too much attention.  i liked so much about this place, i would love to give it a five, and if i do get the chance to visit again, i'm hoping that will change the rating i gave it.

9wT76mKmeWmFKQoL2tUlbw.text: I am from Scotland so when I go back and visit my family we often go here for evening meals. This restaurant is one of the nicest in the city that I have ever been to. The restaurant itself draws from the chic and minimalistic style, if you like Mediterranean food then I strongly recommend you try this place for a meal. The atmosphere here is second to none. Perhaps the selling point for this restaurant is the fact that the prices are reasonable and the food it excellent. If you are a vegetarian then this place offers a healthy menu that I am sure you will love. The restaurant hasn't been open for that long, less than ten years I think but in its short life it has managed to become very well established in the area. The staff and polite and friendly, the service is quick and professional and I seriously can't fault it. I wish it was based here in Manchester because I seriously miss the food. The interior is very calming, it is lit subtle and the dark wood creates a great ambiance. I will be going back here in September when I go back to Scotland. A sausage

j1eUzS_eD9KKIppYaPyl_w.text: My favourite vegetarian restaurant in Edinburgh... never fails to delight!!

oYyKE51wx5KfV8bxYxq-LQ.text: I'm not a vegetarian and I keep forgetting that this place is vegetarian as it is just as delicious as any meat-eating restaurant I've been to. The menu is amazing and is so hard to choose as the dishes are all so original and exciting, but rest assured that whatever you order it will be incredible. The chocolate souffle is the best pudding I have ever had, ever!! The decor is very contemporary and stylish and it's quite a treat to go there.

IoqpN4i9iq51Li--1epbpA.text: I'm not vegetarian but I really enjoy coming here. The menu is quite exciting and rather original, the food is fresh and organic plus it's well priced. The decor is cool, modern and sophisticated. The staff are friendly and enthusiastic and if you're lucky Mr Bann might cook your dish which also adds to the experience.

JB2WqPZVXArwk1pqIPOJGQ.text: Fantastic food, really well thought out menu and plenty of choice. I was there for dinner the other night with friends and we had a great meal, which was sadly ruined by terrible service. Our waiter was rude, aloof and condesending. He may just have been trying to be "funny" but please save that for the fringe and not for dinner.

BF3OZB31TgMxygtxqj0HKg.text: Boring veggie food. Very small portions.

N94zltFO64M25gRMJBjanA.text: very nice food, but bit pricey. good for a romantic date

boQ0unAgM6ygiQYXy312dA.text: Wide ranging menu with choices that should appeal not just to vegetarians but all members of your party - great location, hip atmosphere, and, when I was there at least, pleasant staff. Food was honestly made and tasty...if you're hungry and on a budget, get the huge bowlof soup. Fresh squeezed OJ available if you're craving a dose of vitamin C. If you're veg, this is worth seeking out and was recommended by a local who claims it's a much better place to go than Henderson's.

RHgNAG2eCDr5GeYjC9QACg.text: 56-58 St Mary's Street, Edinburgh, EH1 1SX Tel: 0131 556 5888 Email: info@davidbann.co.uk davidbann.com Celebrity chef David Bann's vegetarian restaurant. I didn't know it could be this tasteful to be a veggi. With a lot of dishes to choose from and often cooked by David himself. You really get what you pay for. Real quality.

VHfKUepqOBUYcHxzqv_n-A.text: I first went to this place with my girlfriend who unlike me is a vegetarian, and was immediately won over even before i'd tried any of the incredible dishes. Chocolate and goats cheese together in a starter? Its one of the ways they really make the most of incredibly fresh produce to give you an exciting menu. Every time i go it feels like an amazing treat, but because its vegetarian i always come out surprised at how little it cost for the quality of food. Well worth it, almost especially if you've never really thought of vegetables as proper food..!

yUltf-w4-Um7PLSbd6pO2g.text: The cheese plate is amazing. Also try the lentil pancake with chocolate sauce.

MESLLari7aVhStHFYBnq1Q.text: I went here for a meal recently with my non-vegetarian family (one of whom usually hates vegetables of all forms) and they were all suitably impressed. I have to say, the noodle dish was a little bit too spicy, and I had far too much mashed potato with my meal, but otherwise, no complaints!  Oh and the desserts were awesome!

yzn_qRe2FFnxmzV3jFZo3A.text: This is my favourite restaurant in the whole world. The dishes are amazing and delicious! I really hope that David will come out with a cookbook so that I can make them at home as I don't live here!

HnSowTeNCUREi96cPucedA.text: The people who were 'disappointed' with this restaurant MUST be meat eaters, or at least vegetarians. As a (newish) vegan who goes here A LOT, I can tell you: DAVID BANN'S IS HEAVEN. Firstly, the service. In my experience the wait-staff are super awesome  obviously there's some rigorous staff training because they all have impeccable manners, and personally I think the service approach is more like a big hotel (Balmoral or similar) than a restaurant of this type usually has. It's above and beyond, really great. I mean, they always make sure you have a replenished water jug on the table, you're never sat for too long with empty plates cluttered in front of you, and if you have questions about what's vegan, what contains nuts or anything else dietary, they never have to say 'oh wait, let me check'  they are extremely knowledgeable about every single dish, all the wines I genuinely have no idea how anyone can fault the service. What?!?! Obviously, carnivores (yay, dead animal flesh and pus! Woo!) will be disappointed here, but for vegans the choice is AMAZING. Seriously  it's not just pasta with olive oil or a baked potato like we're used to. There are actually starters and desserts that vegans can eat! And wines that vegans can drink! The dishes are all creative and original and delicious. In other restaurants I'm sometimes a bit apprehensive about trying new things, but at Bann's I will try anything they put on the menu with total confidence, because I know it is guaranteed to be delicious.  Literally my only fault with this place is that they could change the menu a bit more often. But then my veggie partner was DISTRAUGHT when they took the chocolate souffle off the menu for a while, so maybe the old favourites stick around due to popular demand! LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE  if you haven't yet, go there now!

jtwFrDaL1-hqJXLPrJK5ww.text: Fantastic restaurant, it's always a treat when I go. Really inventive with their food, not carbohydrate heavy like some veggie restaurants tend to be (no pasta in sight!), and the ingredients themselves are high quality and fresh. Impressive wine list, the red Rioja is particularly special (and low in the price range), but you HAVE to make sure you leave room for a dessert - they're heavenly.

ry1PzkBRwTCV1-tCSO16gg.text: I was a little disappointed as well. It's not that the food is bad, just that I was expecting something more... a little more special/ original. The service is good and the restaurant itself is lovely (it's also very well located). However, give the hype I still left feeling a little let down - but maybe that's my fault as I shouldn't have believed the hype.

wVIF9YUJEEC6Ypc0QgzX8A.text: Oh my - this place is great! Really imaginative with the menu. A lot of even specialist veggie food can taste the same with the flavours just mixing together, but this food is something else!

xPxbj4eID8f6NCM1zkwdew.text: It was a few years ago I went there but it is still fresh in my mind the food was wonderfull and the whisky based pudding particularly delicious

HEcAmTpUwfwxZAx7xL1ldw.text: Love this place, great food, great service, and everything made fresh- you ask for alterations to dishes and they'll happily do it, a rarity in city restaurants these days, I was pretty impressed.

lDfpuN-gwpRR6n7vPqzkvg.text: I was disappointed.   I thought they would have more on offer, with such a reputation.   The service was great, but I was not overly impressed with the food.

oyw7PkqOLF6upmTgQqfHzQ.text: This place just goes to show that vegetarian food can be both tasty and healthy. The decor is stylish, the staff very friendly and I didn't find it overpriced, I think the quality of the food justifies it. I had the smoked tofu when I was there and I've never tasted better since, definitely a place to go back to but booking is a must as it's very popular.

E36SPCiOnfcDRUwKA8LeRg.text: I really hate to rain on the parade of this nice and popular restaurant. And there are definitely some very good points - like a very pleasant decor and an immaculate service. But the food .. oh dear !(And I don't mean the fact that it's vegetarian.) Probably because cooked vegetarian food is deemed not very attractive looking, everything but everything comes rolled in a pancake which makes the food both stodgy and soggy. As for flavour - if you've never tasted either coriander or cumin, you'll probably find the dishes intriguing. If you know them, however, the totally overbearing reliance on both of them will soon make you unable to eat yet another forkful.

PHja9GL_tExuVZMqUBp8LA.text: REally good vegetarian food. Even though I eat meat I'm always happy to go here as the food is great. Also the atmosphere is classy rather than the cheap and cheerful ambiance that you often get in vegetarian joint. Also they clearly have a cheese-loving chef, which is always a bonus.

pDuboOPxa54BnOd8BX9fQA.text: A very nice restaurant which serves delcious food (even those who only like veg as a side to meat would have to agree). I had a particularly delicious pudding - but don't read this go an eat for yourself!

EBVDhnrLR245TOnlcEofQA.text: I'm slightly surpirised by the level of praise this place is getting, perhaps it's because Edinburgh has very few vegetarian restaurants. That said, this place has a really good atmosphere and decor and the staff are friendly if a tad slow. The food is of a reasonably high standard and clearly a lot of thought has gone into the dishes. My criticism is mainly that the food lacks flavour to the point of sometimes being bland; a distinct lack of depth of flavour or heat in their curries for instance. It strikes me that this is a slight throwback to the vegetarian=health food mentality of the 70's and 80's.   I still enjoy going here but if you've ever been to Cafe Paradiso in Cork or Terre a Terre in Brighton, this place seems a long way behind.

1m4kIQg84XB3TtTVdODOGw.text: I've been going to Banns for quite a few years - I liked it best when it used to be on Hunter Square and was less upmarket than it is now - used to have a great relaxed, boho feel to it that has gone in the new venue. Always had great meals at Hunter Square, but our experiences at St Marys St have been mixed - once I chose items that sounded great on the menu but were pretty awful on the plate, I'm afraid. We have also found the service to be very slow, even when the place has been really quiet.   We live a long way from Edinburgh and only get to go once or twice a year - Banns used to be a dead cert for us to visit, but the last time we just couldn't be bothered to go - our experiences have been so variable in the new place. Maybe we've just been unlucky, but to our minds there are better veggie places to eat in Edinburgh (Kalpna, Black Bo, Hendersons etc).

VfDjWZI8qEGaogoPGYFOrg.text: Does the idea of a vegetarian restaurant put you in mind of Birkenstock wearing hippies eating lentils from earthenware bowls?  Yes? Then perhaps you should pay a visit to David Bann's to challenge your perceptions. This restaurant has somehow managed to make vegetarian food sexy, stylish and interesting. The menu is packed full of tempting dishes and it's easy to forget that there is no meat on offer. The food is creative and original and takes influence from cuisine from around the world. I used to love the Aduki bean burger with goat's cheese; it's no longer on the menu, but it's good that they change things around regularly to keep it fresh and interesting. Weekend brunch can be a bit of a let-down for non meat eaters (imagine it without bacon or sausages!?!), but David Bann's does a good job of consoling the poor veggie buggers with 'Free range organic eggs cooked your way on toasted muffins, mushrooms, homemade potato scone and beans in a herb tomato sauce', it's served until 5pm on Saturday and Sunday and will only set you back 6.
